data.title: James Franklin Cowan
data.meta_description: COWAN James Franklin, age 62, of Okla. City, passed away Sunday, Nov. 21, 1999 in OKC. He was born on Nov. 12, 1937, in Coleman, Okla. & was the youngest of 6 children. At age 18, James joined the Arâ€¦
data.text:
COWAN James Franklin, age 62, of Okla. City, passed away Sunday, Nov. 21, 1999 in OKC. He was born on Nov. 12, 1937, in Coleman, Okla. & was the youngest of 6 children. At age 18, James joined the Army National Guard and served after the Korean War. For most of his life, James either worked on trucks or was a truck driver. On August 1, 1975, he married Ann Keith. For the past 24 years they have lived in the Blanchard and Okla. City area. James' greatest passion in life was raising, riding & showing Quarter horses. He was a 32nd degree Mason and a member of the Tuttle Lodge #405. He was preceded in death by his father, Bill Cowan; sister, Joy; 2 brothers, Oaftin & Paul. Survivors include his wife, Ann of the home in OKC; mother & step-father, Flora & Ben Williams of Purcell; 4 daughters and their husbands: Debra & Gary Scarberry of OKC, Donna & Dean Armstrong of Union City; Sherry & Steve Kraus of Blanchard and Michelle & Tony Lynch of Moore; 2 brothers, Everett & Helen Harris of OKC and Ed & Bertha Harris of Tishomingo; 9 grandchildren & other loving relatives and friends. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Wed., Nov. 24, 1999, at Wilson-Little Funeral Home Chapel in Purcell. Interment will be at Hillside Cemetery in Purcell. Memorials may be made to Okla. Medical Research Foundation in OKC.

Archive ID: 785651
